channel.title: AllStar - Where is my error?

item.title: AllStar - Where is my error?
item.dc:creator: @Ix_Soulcist_xI Soulcist
item.description:
@Ix_Soulcist_xI wrote:

An else without if error is pretty self explanatory, but I will go over it anyways. The result of such an error happens when using if statements or else/else if statements. Basically, a rule applies to else/else if statements - they need to have a beginning expression. What this means, is there needs to be an if statement before any else/else if statements.

Read full topic

item.title: AllStar - Where is my error?
item.dc:creator: @Marine5287 Marine5287
item.description:
@Marine5287 wrote:

‘else’ without ‘if’ Means there needs to be an “if (expression) {”(without the quotes).

Read full topic

item.title: AllStar - Where is my error?
item.dc:creator: @kingman002 kingman002
item.description:
@kingman002 wrote:

Base: AllStar-Scape
Problem: 1 error
Error: client.java:23355: 'else' without 'if' } else ^ 1 error Press any key to continue . . .

Here is my code, I hope someone can help me, I’m trying to make a better Vengeance. And if I’m not doing something right to make it so you can only use it every 30 seconds, please say so.

case 162: { if (actionTimer == 0) { { actionTimer = 10; stillgfx(401, absY, absX); for (int I = 0; I < 20; I++) {} for (int I = 0; I <= 6; I++) { strPot = true; strPotTimer = 90; cba = abc / 10; abc2 = cba * 2; if (abc2 <= 1) { abc2 = 2; } updateRequired = true; appearanceUpdateRequired = true; break; } inCombat(); attackPlayersWithin(600, 17, 1); actionTimer = 30; setAnimation(4410); txt4 = "Taste Vengeance!"; sendMessage("You use vengence!"); string4UpdateRequired = true; RemoveAllWindows(); } else sendMessage("You can only use Vengeance every 30 seconds."); } } break;

Read full topic
